headline: Down 47% Since March, Is CRISPR Therapeutics Stock a Buy on the Dip?
summary: On Nov. 21, shares of CRISPR Therapeutics (NASDAQ: CRSP) were down 47% from a peak they reached in March.  After all, it's been less than a year since regulators in the U.S. and E.U. approved its first therapy, Casgevy, to treat two blood-based disorders.  Casgevy's initial launch hasn't been as exciting as investors and its partner, Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ: VRTX), had hoped.
